title: What is the momentarily insanity that was pleaded in the history of the USA for the first time? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: This is one of those weird coincidental moments in history. In 1859, Dan Sickles, who was in Congress at the time, shot and killed his wife’s lover, Francis Barton Key, who was the son of Francis Scott Key, the man who wrote the US National anthem. At his subsequent trial, Sickles became the first person to successfully use the “temporary insanity” plea, and was acquitted on those grounds. Sickles went on to join the Union army during the Civil War, and rose to the rank of General. During the Battle of Gettysburg he was insubordinate and did not follow his commander’s orders, which lead to the near destruction of the troops under his command. At that time Sickles was also severely wounded, which led to the amputation of one of his legs. He donated the removed limb to a museum, and for the rest of his life, come and visit his leg on the anniversary of having lost it. Daniel Sickles
